climbs.name: Savory Crêpes
climbs.fa: Kevin Wagner, Erin Filbrandt, Allie Burnett

content.description: Ramp and stem box that gets steeper as one nears the anchors. The route was bolted ground up in Feb 2020 and could still use some cleaning, but this should end up in a clean, safe, easy, and fun route.
content.protection: Five bolts + two bolt anchor; equipped with lower-offs for the last person to get down
content.location: The left-most route at the cliff as of writing, identified by a first bolt placed 15-20 feet up easy ledges.

content.description: Start on a face right of a Saguaro and head straight for the beautiful upper dihedral. Clean climbing in the second half leads to a two bolt anchor on a ledge. Great crack climbing!
content.protection: Single rack, doubles in hand sizes.
content.location: Located near the center of the cliff; the dihedral faces West.

climbs.name: Crumb Cake
climbs.fa: Kevin Wagner, Peter Senchyna, Allie Burnett, Charity Woodrum

content.description: Gear up face and cracks, past a baby saguaro, and into the bolted upper dihedral.
content.protection: Single rack, 6 bolts for protection, 2 bolt anchor.
content.location: Located near where the trail meets the cliff. The East-most route as of writing.

content.description: Extremely sunny crag that is only really climbable on the coldest days of the year, or at night. Several large Saguaro cacti provide a limited amount of shade at the base. The rock is metamorphic and surprisingly good quality for Tucson Mountains, but still beware of loose rocks. Route development began in early 2019 and is still on-going.
